about.description1: Originally from Seattle, now based in La Creuse, France, I create sculptures and functional art pieces that explore the relationship between natural forms and human-made structures. My work is informed by a deep appreciation for materials—their histories, textures, and inherent possibilities.
about.description2: With over two decades of experience, I have exhibited internationally and completed commissions for public and private spaces.

cta.title: Let's Create Together

about.title: About
about.bio1: I am a sculptor and artist, originally from Seattle, now based in La Creuse, France, working primarily with wood, metal, and stone. My practice spans three interrelated areas: sculptural works, functional furniture, and site-specific commissions.
about.bio2: My inspirations often come from the forms or textures of the materials themselves, or during the learning and research process. Most often, I work very intuitively with the conceptual aspects of my work, allowing each piece to evolve organically through dialogue with the material.
about.bio3: With over twenty years of experience, I have exhibited in galleries and museums throughout Scandinavia and Europe, and have completed numerous public and private commissions. My furniture pieces can be found in homes and collections internationally.

philosophy.title: Philosophy
philosophy.quote: I believe that sculpture, at its best, creates a pause—a moment where the viewer is invited to see familiar materials transformed into something unexpected. I strive to honor both the history of the material and its potential for new forms.

studio.title: The Studio
studio.description1: My studio is located in La Creuse, France, in a converted space that provides an ideal environment for working on both intimate and large-scale pieces. The rural setting offers inspiration from the natural landscape and allows for a contemplative approach to my work.
studio.description2: The studio is equipped with both traditional hand tools and modern machinery, allowing me to work across a range of scales and materials. From delicate maquettes to monumental public sculptures, each piece is conceived and developed in this space.
studio.description3: Studio visits can be arranged by appointment for collectors, curators, and those interested in commissioning work.

wood.title: Wood
wood.description: Oak, walnut, ash, cherry, and reclaimed timber. I work with both local French woods and carefully sourced exotic species.

metal.title: Metal
metal.description: Bronze, steel, cor-ten, brass, and copper. From casting to welding, each technique offers unique possibilities.

stone.title: Stone
stone.description: Marble, granite, limestone, and local French stone. Traditional carving methods alongside contemporary approaches.

cta.title: Get in Touch
cta.description: For exhibition inquiries, commission requests, or studio visits, please don't hesitate to contact me.

sculpture.title: Sculpture
sculpture.description: My sculptural work explores the dialogue between organic forms and geometric structures. Working primarily with wood, metal, and stone, I seek to capture moments of tension and harmony in three-dimensional space.

step1.title: Observation
step1.description: Each piece begins with careful observation of natural forms, textures, and the inherent qualities of materials.

step2.title: Exploration
step2.description: Through sketches and maquettes, I explore possibilities, allowing the concept to evolve organically.

step3.title: Creation
step3.description: The final work emerges through an intuitive dialogue between my vision and the material's nature.

furniture.title: Furniture
furniture.description: Where sculpture meets function. Each piece of furniture is conceived as a sculptural object that serves daily life, bringing art into the intimate spaces of the home. I work closely with clients to create bespoke pieces that reflect their unique stories.

philosophy.title: Function & Form
philosophy.description1: My furniture pieces are born from the same creative impulse as my sculptures, but with an additional dimension: they must be lived with, touched, used daily.
philosophy.description2: This constraint becomes an opportunity to explore how sculptural forms can enhance everyday moments—a table that invites gathering, a chair that embraces the body, a shelf that displays not just objects but memories.
philosophy.description3: Each piece is handcrafted using traditional joinery techniques combined with contemporary design sensibilities, ensuring both beauty and longevity.

custom.title: Custom Orders
custom.description: Interested in a bespoke piece for your home or project? I welcome collaborations with architects, interior designers, and private collectors to create unique furniture that responds to specific needs and spaces.

commissions.title: Commissions
commissions.description: Throughout my career, I have had the privilege of creating site-specific works for public spaces, corporate environments, and private collections. Each commission begins with a deep understanding of the space, its purpose, and the people who will interact with the work.

step1.title: Initial Consultation
step1.description: We begin with a conversation about your vision, the space, budget, and timeline. I visit the site when possible to understand the environment and its unique characteristics.

step2.title: Concept Development
step2.description: I develop initial concepts through sketches, digital renderings, and scale maquettes. This phase allows for exploration and refinement of ideas before committing to materials.

step3.title: Fabrication
step3.description: Once the design is approved, I begin the fabrication process in my studio, working with skilled artisans when required. Regular updates keep you informed of progress.

step4.title: Installation
step4.description: I personally oversee the installation to ensure the work is presented exactly as envisioned. For large-scale pieces, I coordinate with engineers and installation teams.

public.title: Public Art
public.description: Sculptures for parks, plazas, civic buildings, and cultural institutions that engage communities and enhance public spaces.

corporate.title: Corporate
corporate.description: Statement pieces for lobbies, headquarters, and office environments that reflect organizational values and inspire creativity.

private.title: Private
private.description: Bespoke works for homes, gardens, and private collections that become treasured parts of daily life.

cta.title: Start a Conversation
cta.description: Every commission begins with a conversation. I would love to hear about your project and explore how we might work together.
